content:
Diagnosis:
Prostate adenocarcinoma, right base
T2a N0 M0, Gleason 3+3=6
Initial PSA 4.8 ng/mL (January 2024)

Previous Treatment:
Radical prostate radiotherapy completed March 2024
74Gy in 37 fractions using VMAT technique

Current Situation:
Routine follow-up at 3 months post-radiotherapy

Current PSA 1.2 ng/mL (stable)

I reviewed [redacted name] in follow-up clinic today. He has recovered well from his radiotherapy treatment which was completed in March. His urinary symptoms have largely resolved with only mild frequency remaining. His bowel function has returned to normal. He maintains good energy levels and has resumed his regular golf activities.

On examination today, his performance status is 0. Digital rectal examination shows post-radiotherapy changes only with no concerning features.

His PSA has shown an appropriate early response, dropping from 4.8 to 1.2. We will continue PSA monitoring every 3 months for the first year. I have arranged his next PSA check for August 2024 with clinic review to follow. He understands to contact us sooner if he develops any new concerns.

cancer_timeline.value: Completed radical prostate radiotherapy 74Gy in 37 fractions using VMAT technique
PSA decreased to 1.2 ng/mL showing appropriate early response

patient_facts.value: Digital rectal examination shows post-radiotherapy changes only with no concerning features

status_updates.value: Early stage prostate cancer treated with radical radiotherapy. Good initial response with appropriate PSA reduction and minimal residual symptoms
PSA decreased from 4.8 to 1.2 showing appropriate early response to radiotherapy
Clinic review to follow PSA check in August 2024
